verses.verse: (1 How the Israelites were delivered forth of Egypt, and of the wonderful miracles that God wrought at that time. Which put us in remembrance of God’s great mercy toward his Church, who when the course of nature faileth, preserveth his miraculously. ) When (Cross references: : Exod. 13:5) Israel went out of Egypt, and the house of Jacob from the (That is, from them that were of a strange language.) barbarous people,
Judah was his (The whole people were witnesses of his holy majesty, in adopting them, and of his mighty power in delivering them.) sanctification, and Israel his dominion.
The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was turned back.

The (Seeing that these dead creatures felt God’s power, and after a sort saw it, much more his people ought to consider it, and glorify him for the same.) mountains leaped like rams, and the hills as lambs!
What ailed thee, O sea, that thou fleddest? O Jordan, why wast thou turned back?
Ye mountains why leaped ye like rams, and ye hills as lambs?
The (Ought then his people to be insensible when they see his power and majesty?) earth trembled at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
Which (That is, caused miraculously water to come out of the rock in most abundance, Exod. 17:6.) turneth the rock into waterpools, and the flint into a fountain of water.
